headline: Adobe weaker revenue guidance for current quarter offsets Q4 results beat
summary: Investing.com -- Adobe reported Wednesday fiscal fourth-quarter results that beat estimates, but softer revenue guidance for the current quarter weighed on the stock in afterhours trading.

headline: Adobe beats Q4 estimates, but stock slipping on 2025 forecast
summary: Adobe (ADBE) released positive results for its fiscal fourth quarter, releasing revenue of $5.61 billion ($5.54 billion was expected) while topping adjusted earnings estimates with a figure of $4.81 per share ($4.67 was expected). Wall Street seems disappointed on the software company's 2025 revenue forecast of $23.3 billion to $23.55 billion, while analysts were anticipating $23.78 billion. Market Domination Overtime hosts Julie Hyman and Josh Lipton react to Adobe's earnings print and discuss the touch on the company's portfolio of creative software powered by AI. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime here. This post was written by Luke Carberry Mogan.

headline: Adobe forecasts fiscal 2025 revenue below estimates on slower subscription spending
summary: Photoshop maker Adobe forecast fiscal 2025 revenue below Wall Street estimates on Wednesday, suggesting the company's investments to weave AI into its software applications were taking longer than expected to bear fruit. Shares of the San Jose, California-based company fell nearly 9% in extended trading. The company forecast annual revenue for 2025 between $23.30 billion and $23.55 billion, compared with estimates of $23.78 billion, according to data compiled by LSEG.

headline: Adobe: Fiscal Q4 Earnings Snapshot
summary: The average estimate of 13 analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of $4.66 per share. The software maker posted revenue of $5.61 billion in the period, also beating Street forecasts. Ten analysts surveyed by Zacks expected $5.54 billion.

raw.headline: Adobe: Fiscal Q4 Earnings Snapshot
raw.summary: The average estimate of 13 analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of $4.66 per share. The software maker posted revenue of $5.61 billion in the period, also beating Street forecasts. Ten analysts surveyed by Zacks expected $5.54 billion.

headline: Adobe’s (NASDAQ:ADBE) Q4 Sales Beat Estimates But Full-Year Sales Guidance Misses Expectations Significantly
summary: Creative software maker Adobe (NASDAQ:ADBE) reported Q4 CY2024 results beating Wall Street’s revenue expectations, with sales up 11.1% year on year to $5.61 billion. On the other hand, next quarter’s revenue guidance of $5.66 billion was less impressive, coming in 1.2% below analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $4.81 per share was 3% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

raw.headline: Adobe’s (NASDAQ:ADBE) Q4 Sales Beat Estimates But Full-Year Sales Guidance Misses Expectations Significantly
raw.summary: Creative software maker Adobe (NASDAQ:ADBE) reported Q4 CY2024 results beating Wall Street’s revenue expectations, with sales up 11.1% year on year to $5.61 billion. On the other hand, next quarter’s revenue guidance of $5.66 billion was less impressive, coming in 1.2% below analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $4.81 per share was 3% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: November CPI, Macy's Q3 earnings: What to Watch
summary: November's Consumer Price Index (CPI) reading — the measurement of inflation in prices of consumer goods and services — is due out Wednesday morning, where economists are forecasting total and core CPI to rise by 0.3% each. Software giant Adobe (ADBE) will also be reporting its fiscal fourth quarter earnings, alongside Macy's (M) after the department store delayed releasing third quarter figures upon discovering an employee hid $154 million in shipping expenses. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime here. This post was written by Luke Carberry Mogan.
